alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 11 at 4:03AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following county, Wake. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 359 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that the heavy rain which fell over the last 24 hours has resulted in rises on area creeks and streams across Wake county, including Crabtree Creek, Swift Creek, and Walnut Creek. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen since yesterday. - Water will gradually recede through sunrise. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Cary, Wake Forest, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Zebulon, RDU International, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville, Knightdale, Wendell, Rolesville, Lake Wheeler, Lake Benson, William B Umstead State Park, Falls Lake Boat Ramp, Carpenter, Falls Lake and Purnell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
